newsitem.title: USA: ABC/Money consumer comfort index 1.0 May 25 week.
newsitem.headline: ABC/Money consumer comfort index 1.0 May 25 week.

text.p: The Money Magazine/ABC News index of consumer comfort rose two points, to a 10-1/2 year high of 1.0, in the week ended May 25 from the prior week.
The survey, polls consumers nationwide about the national economy, their own finances and their willingness to spend money.
Respondents' confidence in the economy rose to 6.0 from 2.0 the previous week.
Confidence in personal finances held steady at 16, while the rating of buying climate rose to -18 from -20 in the prior week.
Regionally, confidence declined in the South and in the Midwest, falling one point to -4.0 and to 7.0 from 9.0, respectively.
It rose in the Northeast to 4.0 from -1.0, and in the West to 0 from -5.0.
The current poll has a margin error of plus or minus 3.5 percentage points.
